Body: Possible Duplicate:  What is the right way to close apps in Android?  After using my Samsung Galaxy S III for a while, closing apps and dialogs with the "back" button (front-right), I pressed and held the front-middle button, which brought up a list of all windows and apps I had been using.I suppose that means that they were still running in the background. How to close them properly?
Title: How to properly close a program in Samsung Galaxy S3?

history.Text: After using my Samsung Galaxy S III for a while, closing apps and dialogs with the "back" button (front-right), I pressed and held the front-middle button, which brought up a list of _all_ windows and apps I had been using.I suppose that means that they were still running in the background. How to close them properly?
How to properly close a program in Samsung Galaxy S3?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [What is the right way to close apps in Android?](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/927/what-is-the-right-way-to-close-apps-in-android)  After using my Samsung Galaxy S III for a while, closing apps and dialogs with the "back" button (front-right), I pressed and held the front-middle button, which brought up a list of _all_ windows and apps I had been using.I suppose that means that they were still running in the background. How to close them properly?
